[Music]
you
[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
rapport my name is Dave and this is
episode 1410 a and today's date is
October 25th 2017 and the thought of the
episode is the economy is collapsing one
city at a time now before I get started
I just want to make an announcement I
uploaded an interview with David Quinn
Terry it is on the x-22 report spotlight
YouTube channel so all you need to do is
go over to YouTube type in X we need to
report spotlight will bring you right to
the interview or you can come over to
the X 20 to report calm site or new
Sentinel com scroll down a little bit
look over to your right hand side you
can play the video right on the site or
you can go to steam it calm that is
steam it calm /at X 20 to report and you
can play the interview on steam it let's
get into the economic collapse financial
news now we've been talking about the
housing market and how the housing
market isn't doing well and it's not
just here in the United States it's in
many different countries and up in
Canada what we're seeing is that just
over 50 percent of Millennials age 30
owned their own homes the latest census
shows compared to 55 percent of baby
boomers at the same exact age and what
is happening right now is that the cost
of these homes they are very very high
because since 2011 the census shows the
value of homes has steadily increased to
a national average of four hundred and
forty three thousand up from three
hundred and forty five thousand so it
looks like it it's gone up almost a
hundred actually it has gone up a
hundred thousand dollars now Vancouver
has had the highest prices in the
country with the average home value over
1 million Toronto is around seven
hundred and thirty-four thousand Calgary
around five hundred twenty seven
thousand and Montreal came in around
three hundred and sixty six thousand and
what we're seeing right now is that the
census data shows that more people are
completely out of the market and they
are going to rent their homes instead of
purchasing their homes because these
bubbles have been blown up so high that
it's completely out of reach to the
everyday first-time homebuyer or
even the existing home buyers and this
cannot be sustained because when incomes
don't you know keep pace with the home
values what happens is there's a
separation and we saw this back in
2007-2008 and eventually these bubbles
start to pop and we've shown many many
graphs of bubbles all over the place and
what we're seeing right now is the top
of the bubbles in many different areas
many different cities the bubble is
starting to pop and we'll talk about
that in a little bit but I wanted to
mention something that happened with
gold right now now Mexico announced it
would increase its foreign exchange
hedging program due to inflation fears
and then all of a sudden and normally we
see the opposite happen where people
will dump you know thousands upon
thousands of gold future contracts and
bring the price of gold down this time
someone bought seventeen thousand gold
future contracts over 2 billion notional
driving the precious metals up not down
this time and that is very interesting
because what we're seeing is that people
are starting to listen they're starting
to observe and they're starting to
realize that there is definitely
something wrong with the economy economy
and in all different countries we are
going to see inflation because the
United States sees inflation other
countries are going to see inflation
actually other countries are seeing
inflation but it's going to get much
much worse here in the United States we
see that durable good orders they have
stagnated below 2007 highs for the last
four years and thanks to a better than
expected 2.2 percent jump in September
the year-on-year gain was an impressive
sounding eight point three percent and
we could see at this point that this has
been driven up by you know airplanes and
things like that and it's continually
being pushed up but when you look at it
over a period of time since 2011 durable
good orders they have really gone
nowhere whatsoever it's pretty much a
flat line and it goes up it goes down
but nothing has really happened
with durable goods it's been holding
steady and this is exactly what they
wanted to do they wanted bring it up
with airplane orders or whatever they
parts and things like that it comes back
down
they readjust the numbers they revise
the numbers they go back in time and
they continually do this now back to the
housing crisis here in the United States
we are seeing that there are many cities
out there which case Euler looks at and
the Fed looks at this the corporate
media looks at this and says okay
the housing prices are continually
moving up and up and up and that means
the housing market is strong and then if
you look outside the 20 cities we see
that housing is really not that strong
we see outside of the 20 cities well
there are individuals that are holding
onto their homes the value of the homes
are coming down it's becoming harder and
harder to sell these homes and I think
what is happening just like it happened
back in 2008 is that we're going to see
this housing crisis occur city by city
and New York is already beginning the
process we also see out in California
San Francisco the Bay Area well it is
happening there and in other cities
within California now pending home sales
in California fell 6 percent in
September compared to a year ago now
this is the third month in a row
year-over-year that this has declined
after having dropped around three point
five percent in August and two point six
percent in July and you need to keep in
mind the summer months are the most
popular month for housing this is what
the Realtors wait for they wait for the
spring and the summer to sell these
homes now entering the fall home buying
season the housing market momentum is
dead in the water the California
Association of Realtors said in this
report that brokers reported slower open
house traffic and listing appointments
and client presentations fell below
positive territory in September now
pending home sales they are an
indication of what actual sales might
look like over the next few months and
right now they don't
look good out in the San Francisco area
and we're not just seeing it in San
Francisco we're seeing it in other
series but in San Francisco the pending
home sales plunged by ten point eight
percent year-over-year after plunging 11
points sank eleven point six percent in
August eleven point five percent in July
it was a 12 month in a row of a
year-over-year declines in the two
counties that make up Silicon Valley San
Mateo and Santa Clara pending home sales
plummeted around twenty two point four
percent and twenty three point five
percent now in Southern California
pending home sales fell around seven
point one percent year-over-year after
form three point eight percent in August
and when we look at all the different
counties we see Los Angeles San Diego
Riverside San Bernardino they have
fallen between negative 0.8 percent all
the way down to thirteen point four
percent and this is a complete and utter
disaster and what we're seeing right now
is we're seeing that the housing market
is coming down now think about it the
interest rates are at the lowest point
ever I mean the only place we can really
go is may be negative but we are so low
with interest rates and there's you know
home construction companies saying
listen we just need buyers and what
we'll do is those people that have
student loans will help pay student
loans off if they just purchase a home
and we can see that you know Fannie Mae
Freddie Mac they're gonna guarantee some
of these loans and we can see that banks
now are giving 0% no money down they're
trying to do everything to get people in
to purchase home but the everyday
American they're on the sidelines
they're not purchasing the foreign
investments it is drawing up right now
and the hedge funds investment companies
well guess what they can't continually
purchase these homes forever because
once again they know there's going to be
a top and they'll need to sell these
homes and this is what we're seeing
right now we are hitting the top in some
cities we've already hit the top and
we're coming down so we're gonna see a
cascading effect city by city
and it's gonna start to fall and we saw
this back in 2006 2007 2008 out in
California people were leaving their
homes because interest rates started to
move up they had adjustable rate
mortgages they couldn't afford them and
everything started to fall apart we're
seeing the same patterns they're
repeating what happened back in 2008
it's like deja vu and this is going to
spread to city to city to city and
everything outside of those cities that
we're the bubble has been pumped up it's
just going to get worse a lot faster
because remember outside of these cities
things are already pretty darn bad where
people can't sell their homes prices are
coming down traffic is drying up and as
these Shiller cities start to plummet
guess what it's going to affect the
outer areas and it's going to hit each
city now when is each city gonna get hit
well we don't know that but the bigger
cities we can see it's already starting
New York we know there's a problem we
know there's a problem in the condo
market but we're gonna see it hit Miami
actually we're already getting
indication that condo sales are slowing
speculators are pulling back San
Francisco we're already seeing that
there's a huge problem out there and
this is going to spread and it's going
to get faster and faster and again the
corporate media and everyone else is not
going to know what to do because once
the housing market goes down people will
lose confidence because people when they
see their homes going up in value for
some reason they think oh the economy
must be doing well I feel secure I can
take a home equity line of credit out I
can purchase a new car I can pay for
college I can put a new roof on the
house and when the values start coming
down people start to get nervous people
start to get scared they believe the
economy is starting to fail actually
what's happening is the bubbles that
were created by the Federal Reserve
they're starting to pop because we're
living in an illusionary world we're
living in a world where they
created this illusionary recovery which
really doesn't exist and when it starts
to completely implode on itself people
are going to get very very nervous and
really everything is going to start to
accelerate all over the place this is
why you need to be ready and prepared
for what is coming because we're already
starting to see the beginning stages of
this and once it starts it's just going
to accelerate city to city to city and
it's gonna be moving outward and it's
just going to get a lot worse so get
prepared because here we go
listen everyone thanks a lot for
listening be well be safe and especially
be prepared thanks a lot
[Music]
you
